oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Employees standing on the ovens
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Work
African American iron and steel workers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Douglas Coal and Coke Company purchased 14,000 acres in Dunlap in 1900 and constructed 50 coke ovens, several coal mines, and a company town by 1902. In 1905, the Chattanooga Iron and Coal Company purchased the operation. The company continued until 1919.
